name: Hardest The Elements Argon! Trivia Quiz | Fractured Words | 10 Questions

questions.text: I led my pencil through the sharpener, as it was getting dull.
questions.explanation:
Lead.

	LED - LEAD Lead is a metal that was once used in many things, though it was later discovered as being poisonous.  Lead was often used in pencils, but graphite took its place, though the graphite in pencils is still often called "lead".

questions.text: I earned enough money last week to buy myself a skillet to replace my rusty old one!
questions.explanation:
Iron & sulfur.

	I EARNed - IRON Iron is used to make cast iron skillets.  Rust is the common name for iron oxide.

questions.text: I had to wash my brass instrument in the sink because I had dropped it in mud.
questions.explanation:
Zinc & tin.

	SINK - ZINC Zinc is one of the elements in brass, a metal alloy.  The other element in brass is copper.

questions.text: I had my tongue stunned when I tried to lick the lightbulb!
questions.explanation:
Tungsten.

	TONGUE STUNned - TUNGSTEN Tungsten is also known as wolfram.  It is used in things such as bullets, x-ray tubes, and lightbulb filaments.

questions.text: I was shocked when I heard that Jennifer Lopez' rotten eggs from her breakfast the week before would sell for over $1,000!
questions.explanation:
Sulfur & Sulphur.

	SELL FOR - SULFUR Sulfur is used in many things, such as matches and insecticides.  It is said to smell like rotten eggs.  A great example of this stench is in the sulfur pools of Yellowstone.

questions.text: I ran out of grout while putting in my brand new flooring, so I used toothpaste instead (it didn't work too well).
questions.explanation:
Fluorine.

	FLOORING - FLUORINE Toothpaste often has fluoride in it to whiten your teeth.  Fluoride is an ion of fluorine.

questions.text: I could say the sun's golden ray; dawn was approaching my poisoned house.
questions.explanation:
Radon.

	RAY; DAWN - RADON Radon is an odorless, colorless, and tasteless noble gas.  If too much radon leaks into someone's house, it can be poisonous and deadly.

questions.text: Our scenic view of our beautiful backyard was being choked by weeds, so we used some herbicide to rid ourselves of the pests.
questions.explanation:
Arsenic.

	OUR SCENIC - ARSENIC Arsenic is often used in pesticides, such as herbicides and insecticides.  Arsenic was also often used in earlier centuries to treat many illnesses, and is still used to treat some cancers.

questions.text: My uncle isn't very thoughtful with his gifts; last time he got us toothpaste, matches, and loofahs for us.
questions.explanation:
Phosphorus.

	louFAS FOR US - PHOSPHORUS Phosphorus is used in many things, such as matches, toothpaste, and explosives.  It is often common in some fertilizers.

questions.text: I was told to put on my glasses while pouring cement for the driveway, but other silly construction workers didn't.
questions.explanation:
Silicon.

	SILLY CONstruction - SILICON Silicon is used in many different things, such as cement, ceramics, and some glass.  It is also used to make silicone; perhaps you have silicone oven mitts, muffin tins, or cutting boards in your kitchen.
